  • Field Details

    • inputThread

      private final Thread inputThread

      private final BlockingQueue<String> inputs

    • scanner

      private final Scanner scanner

  • Constructor Details

    • ThreadInputReader

      public ThreadInputReader()
      Constructs a new ThreadInputReader and starts the input reading thread. The thread continuously reads input from the console and adds it to the queue.

  • Method Details

    • stop

      public void stop()
      Stops the input reading thread. This method should be called when the ThreadInputReader is no longer needed to free up system resources.

    • getInput

      public String getInput() throws InterruptedException
      Retrieves and removes the next input string from the queue. This method blocks if the queue is empty until an element becomes available.
      Returns:
      the next input string from the queue
      Throws:
      InterruptedException - if the current thread is interrupted while waiting

    • getInt

      public int getInt() throws InterruptedException
      Retrieves the next input as an integer. This method repeatedly prompts the user until a valid integer is entered.
      Returns:
      the next input as an integer
      Throws:
      InterruptedException - if the current thread is interrupted while waiting

    • getInt

      public int getInt(int min, int max) throws InterruptedException
      Retrieves the next input as an integer within a specified range. This method repeatedly prompts the user until a valid integer within the specified range is entered.
      Parameters:
      min - the minimum acceptable value (inclusive)
      max - the maximum acceptable value (inclusive)
      Returns:
      the next input as an integer within the specified range
      Throws:
      InterruptedException - if the current thread is interrupted while waiting
